isis.stitle: CAB: DAYCAB AND SLEEPER CAB for ProStar, ProStar Premium, and ProStar Limited Models - REMOVE - MODULAR DOOR HARDWARE ASSEMBLY

svcsubproc.title: Remove Cab Door Modular Door Hardware Assembly with Electric Door Window and Locks on Daycab and Sleeper Cab

note.para: Figure 47 below used to show the procedure for removing the cab door modular door hardware assembly shows a cab door modular door hardware assembly with electric door window and locks. The same procedure is used for electric door window and locks and manual door window and locks.

svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 46
for Items in parentheses.

The cab door modular door hardware assembly (Item 1) consists of the window regulator assembly (Item 2), front window run channel (Item 3), rear window run channel (Item 4), inner cab door handle (Item 5), outer cab door handle (Item 6) and door latch (Item 7). This assembly is installed and removed as a module, driver side shown.

Refer to Figure 39
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: For vehicle equipped with electric door window, lower cab door glass (Item 1) to the bottom of cab door (Item 2) before disconnecting electric window switch panel (Item 3) during cab door trim panel (Item 4) removal.

Remove cab door trim panel, refer to
CAB DOOR TRIM PANEL
. For cab door equipped with electric door window and locks, refer to Remove Cab Door Trim Panel with Electric Door Window and Locks on Daycab and Sleeper Cab.

Remove cab door vapor barrier, refer to
CAB DOOR VAPOR BARRIER
. For removing cab door vapor barrier, refer to Remove Cab Door Vapor Barrier with Electric Door Window and Locks on Daycab and Sleeper Cab.

Remove cab door glass, refer to
CAB DOOR GLASS
. For removing cab door glass, refer to Remove Cab Door Glass with Electric Door Window and Locks on Daycab and Sleeper Cab.

svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 46
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Once the cab door trim panel, cab door vapor barrier and cab door glass have been removed per steps 2, 3 and 4 above, the cab door modular door hardware assembly (Item 1) can be removed by removing all mounting hardware associated with all of its components as follows.
Remove three torx head bolts (Item 8) securing door latch assembly (Item 7) to cab door (Item 9), driver side shown.

Using a flat blade screw driver (Item 10), covered with a cloth rag to protect the painted surface of cab door (Item 9), carefully slide screw driver blade between the cab door and outer cab door handle trim bezel (Item 11) and carefully pry outer cab door handle trim bezel away from cab door, driver side shown.

note.para: The plastic tabs that hold the outer cab door handle trim bezel (Item 11) will likely break off during removal. A new outer cab door handle trim bezel will likely be needed if service to the cab door requires removing it.

figure.caption: Figure 46. Cab Door Modular Door Hardware Assembly

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. CAB DOOR MODULAR DOOR HARDWARE ASSEMBLY
11. OUTER CAB DOOR HANDLE TRIM BEZEL

step1.para: Remove four torx pan head screws (Item 12, view arrow A) securing outer cab door handle (Item 6, view arrow A) to cab door (Item 9, view arrow A), driver side shown.
Remove four torx head bolts (Item 13) securing cab door modular door hardware assembly (Item 1) to cab door (Item 9), driver side shown.

Once the four torx head bolts (Item 13) have been removed, slide mounting guide pin (Item 14) of cab door modular door hardware assembly (Item 1) out of cab door (Item 9) and slide cab door modular door hardware assembly to the right to get it out from behind cab door, then lift it up and pull the bottom out and drop it down out of the cab door access opening, driver side shown.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 47 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Disconnect wiring harness connector (Item 1) from the electric window motor (Item 2), driver side shown.

Once cab door modular door hardware assembly (Item 3) is free from cab door (Item 4), reach behind cab door modular door hardware assembly and squeeze together push-in fasteners four places (Item 5) and push them through cab door modular door hardware assembly. Disconnect wiring harness connector (Item 6) from door latch assembly (Item 7), driver side shown. Position wiring harness out of the way and remove cab door modular door hardware assembly. Inner cab door handle (Item 5, Figure 46)
removed for clarity. Lay cab door modular door hardware assembly on a suitable work surface and save for installation.

calloutgroup.callout1: 3. CAB DOOR MODULAR DOOR HARDWARE ASSEMBLY

step1.para: Repeat procedure to remove passenger side cab door modular door hardware assembly.
